revised_title: Hybridization of Quagga and Arabian Horse
tldr: The Earl of Morton, F.R.S., shares a unique observation on the hybridization of a male Quagga and an Arabian mare. The resulting offspring display features from both species, particularly the Quagga's distinctive stripes. This raises the question of how traits from the dam can be passed on to the progeny, even when the sire does not possess them.
